intro: Matelea quinquedentata, commonly known as the five-toothed matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are hairy and branching. Matelea quinquedentata is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, making it an adaptable species in harsh climates.
